data.event: As of 2011, the city's population was estimated to be 24,285.
Today Lafayette is known for its wealthy inhabitants and pastoral rolling hills.
In 2012, estimated median household income in Lafayette was over 150,000 dollars, more than double the statewide average and nearly triple the national average.

These initial contacts developed into conflict, with years of armed struggle, including a battle on what is currently Lafayette soil in 1797 between the Saclan and the Spanish, and eventually resulting in the subjugation of the native population.

event.title: a battle on what is currently Lafayette soil in 1797

event.title: was given as a Mexican land grant, Rancho Acalanes to Candelario Valencia in 1834

data.event: Most of what is currently Lafayette was given as a Mexican land grant, Rancho Acalanes to Candelario Valencia in 1834.
